adr_address: 36 Gd Rue Saint-Michel, 31400 Toulouse, France

editorial_summary.overview: Modern units in a laid-back apartment hotel offering a fitness room, a badminton court & breakfast.

name: Lagrange apart'HOTEL - Toulouse Saint-Michel

reviews.text: Highly unrecommended. Rude staff, the receptionist takes the word unhelpful to a whole new level, zero client compassion or understanding, she shouldn't be anywhere near the hospitality business. Such a toxic culture at this place, Avoid at all costs they deserve to go out of business

We checked in at around 11pm, we weren't made aware that the hotel closed after 10pm, there wasn't much we could do as our booked flight didn't land until 10.30pm, there is a number provided on the door, and the staff were good to let us in and checked us in, so no complaints in the service department.

The room: Very dated, bed was EXTREMELY firm, almost like sleeping on the floor, only one pillow provided for each person, if you are broad shouldered like myself, you will have a terrible nights sleep. We did ask for a further pillow, which was provided on the second night. The kitchenette was nice enough, but we made use of the location and ate out every day. Nothing really special or bad about the room as a whole, other than the bed, and for some reason, no coffee or tea was provided, however, if you want to there is a spar opposite from which you can purchase everything. Everything was clean so that's a plus.

Location: The location was good, about 20-30 minutes to the Capitole square, but there's plenty of shops, cafe's etc in between, so the walk isn't much of an issue.

In summary, I would consider this a 3* accommodation, at best, possibly 2* to the more picky traveller. Toulouse is a beautiful city, with equally lovely people, scratch up on your French, you'll certainly need it! Best of luck to future travellers, we hope you love Toulouse as much as we did.

The hotel was clean , rooms a little outdated ,but great location to the city. (Absolutely beautiful city) We were locked out of hotel on arrival past midnight with my teenage daughter and mom. Tried ringing number that was displayed on the window with no further information as to how to get in to the building. Finally got in and settled. On arrival we had to pay a €300 deposit which was unknown to us when booking the holiday through a company,  now a month today we still have not received any deposit back . The receptionest said we were cleared to get it back an should have been in within a few days of our departure 😔

Loved Toulouse. This apartment was located a modest walk into the centre and near the brilliant metro line. The room was fine enough. We ordered a cot for a baby but on arrival were told there was no cot left so we had to use the sofa bed for the child. On second night we got a cot.

Parking was underground for €11 per night (although I later realised I'd been over charged) - arrive at gate to car park then go in to get a key for parking before checking in. There is a new Low Emission Zone in Toulouse with a complex sticker system which our hire car didn't have. The apartment is in the zone. Apparently camera enforcement may be introduced in 2024 but in 2023 we were advised that because we were parking underground there was no chance the restriction would be enforced so we had to just hope. I've no idea how we could have got a sticker to follow the rules - so confusing. Apartment needed more info on this when booking in my opinion.

Awesome apartment hotel. The fact that they allowed me to bring the bike up in the apartment gives them my 5 stars! Great staff, spacious rooms and bathroom, no bathtub in my room, but maybe others have.

Electric blinds on the window, flat scree TV, small kitchen, but equipped with all that you might need (except stove, just a cook top).

Wi-Fi router for each apartment, so the signal is great!

And again, awesome staff! Love my choice to come here. And price is not much higher than another hotel in another city... Totally worth it!
